result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Cause Injury while Operating with PAC (1st)(PAC>=0.15)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Natasha Monique Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Natasha Monique Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Basil Martin Loeb appeared by video for Natasha Monique Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. State advises the Court this case is in a DPA resolution posture and suggests defendant get a TAD evaluation. Defense requests a DPA date. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Natasha Monique Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Basil Martin Loeb appeared by video for Natasha Monique Smith.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense counsel has not received an offer from the State and is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture.  
Case adjourned to Branch 30. 
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Natasha Monique Smith in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Natasha Monique Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. State informs the court this case may be in DPA posture. 
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Natasha Monique Smith in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Natasha Monique Smith appeared by video means.  
Case in court for status conference.  Case is in resolution posture. State is requesting a status conference date. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
At the request of the Court, matter is rescheduled. Parties notified.  Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Natasha Monique Smith in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Natasha Monique Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DOS.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Natasha Monique Smith in court with attorney Basil Martin Loeb.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
